REST API User¶

async src.routers.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes an email and password as input, hashes the password, and stores it in the database. The function returns a UserModel object with all of its fields filled out.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The owner object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routers.users.delete_user(owner_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The delete_user function deletes a user from the database.

The function takes in an owner_id as a path parameter and uses it to find the user in the database. If no such user is found, then an HTTPException is raised with status code 404 (Not Found). Otherwise, if such a user exists, then that particular row of data is deleted from the table.

Parameters:

  • owner_id – int: Specify the id of the owner that will be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The deleted owner

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routers.users.get_user(user_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user function returns a user object based on the id passed in.

If no user is found, it will return an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Get the user id from the path, and db: session = depends(get_db) is used to connect to the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The owner of the item, so it returns a user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routers.users.get_users(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_users function returns a list of all users in the database.
return:

A list of dictionaries containing user information.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routers.users.update_user(body: UserModel, owner_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_user function updates a user in the database.

The function takes an owner_id and a body as input, where the body is of type OwnerModel. If no owner with that id exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404 (Not Found). Otherwise, it updates the email field of that user to be equal to what was passed in through the request body.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • owner_id – int: Get the id of the owner from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent
